subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Wahhabism: Islam's Puritanical Revival
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Wahhabism: Islam's Puritanical Revival.

hook.text: Strip away all innovation, return to the original Islam. That idea, born in 1744, now funds mosques worldwide.

buildup.text: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab preached that most Muslims had strayed from true Islam through superstition and shrines.

discovery.text: He allied with the Saud family. Their pact created Saudi Arabia â€” a state built on puritanical religious ideology.

twist.text: Oil wealth turned Wahhabism from a desert sect into a global movement. Saudi money funds mosques and schools everywhere.

climax.text: Wahhabism's influence on global Islam is enormous and controversial. Reform movements often begin as rigid reactions.

punchline.text: A desert preacher plus oil money reshaped global Islam. Purity went global.

quiz.question: What is Wahhabism?
options: A puritanical Islamic reform movement that influences Saudi Arabia
